DOC.brief_summary: Dietary carbohydrate is the major determinant of postprandial glucose levels, and preliminary evidence suggests that low carbohydrate diets improve glycemic control when accompanied by weight loss. To determine if glycemic control can be improved by varying dietary carbohydrate during weight loss, we compared two weight loss diets with different carbohydrate levels for the treatment of obesity-related type 2 diabetes over 24 weeks in the outpatient setting.
DOC.brief_title: Lifestyle Modification for Obesity-Related Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: type 2 diabetes mellitus for at least one year hgba1c > 6.0 BMI from 2750 kg/m2 Unstable medical condition Serious medical condition AST or ALT > 100 Serum creatinine > 1.5
